alert.note: Alert for Conecuh; Escambia (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 18 at 1:56PM CST until December 18 at 7:30PM CST by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Alabama, including the following counties, Conecuh and Escambia. * WHEN...Until 500 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 155 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... I65 And AL 113, I65 And AL 21, Barnett Crossroads, Wallace, Stanley Crossroads, Sardine, Range, Little Rock, Lenox, Martinville and London. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
